text: Luynes () is a commune in the Indre-et-Loire department in central France. ==Population== == Sights == The Castle of Luynes has been registered as a historic site since 1926. The construction started in the 13th century, and the building was redesigned in the 15th and 17th century. Luynes Aqueduct A Roman aqueduct which carried water to Tours is visible as a series of piers, some still connected by arches, where it crosses a small valley between Luynes and Fondettes.Roman France, Knight, Jeremy (2001) , p. 60 ==See also== *Communes of the Indre-et-Loire department ==References== ==External links== Category:Communes of Indre-et-Loire
title: Luynes, Indre-et-Loire
